column4: can anyone tell me how to make a menu in gnome that just shows places
i did it relatively easily in XFCE
but i just switched back to gnome and would like to do it
use XBMC
its best app for xbox
you dont need a server with XBMC
just samba sharing
anyone know how to make a places menu
with gnome
What do you mean by places menu? You want to add folders?
i mean like by default it has Main  Places and System or whatever
I don't believe that is possible because nobody make an applet for that one.
You use it for netbook?
That is the path. Or ~/.themes (for personal themes).
You could try and use xfce4-panel?
I understand that but the great thing about it is that you could run just about anything. (Yes, that is what I mean by that).
aptitude install -yRs xfce4-places-plugin (-R for eliminating recommends).
Won't hurt to try. :)
Great. You could use Gnome panel on top and XFCE panel on bottom then. I don't know why I didn't thought of that yesterday. :o
Do you have OpenOffice?
That is it.
